questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents to the clinic with symptoms of fatigue, joint pain, and a facial rash that worsens with sun exposure. Laboratory tests reveal the presence of anti-nuclear antibodies (ANA) and low complement levels. Which of the following mechanisms is primarily responsible for the contributing to her pathogenesis?

options.label: C
options.text: Failure of B cell receptor editing

questions.correct_answer: C. Failure of B cell receptor editing
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Failure of B cell receptor editing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thus, central tolerance is the primary mechanism that prevents autoimmunity by eliminating self-reactive lymphocytes during their development.

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents due to recurrent ear infections, chronic diarrhea, and eczema. On examination, he has small bruises and petechiae on his skin. Laboratory findings reveal a low platelet count and normal levels of white blood cells and red blood cells. The child’s family history is significant for a maternal uncle who died at a young age due to a bleeding disorder. What is the most appropriate next step in the diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Flow cytometry for CD40 ligand expression

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic testing for WASP gene mutation

questions.correct_answer: C. Genetic testing for WASP gene mutation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Genetic testing for WASP gene mutation

questions.text: Which of the following cannot be the presenting feature of Hodgkin lymphoma? Rapid growing mass affecting Waldeyer’s ring Painless cervical lymphadenopathy GI polyps Rapid growing mass affecting mandible
Which of the following is most appropriate component for reducing the risk of graft verus host disease?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a 6-month history of diarrhea, weight loss, and abdominal bloating. She reports that her stools are pale, bulky, and foul-smelling. She has also noticed an itchy rash on her elbows and knees. Her past medical history is unremarkable. On physical examination, she has multiple excoriations on her elbows and a mildly distended abdomen. Laboratory tests reveal a mild anemia. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A man with a renal disease presents to the clinic with worsening fatigue and muscle weakness. Further studies reveal increased lipid peroxidation products and decreased glutathione levels in his blood. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely contributing to his ongoing cellular injury?

A 5-year-old boy is evaluated for recurrent sinopulmonary infections, including pneumonia and otitis media. He has a history of poor growth and chronic diarrhea. Laboratory studies reveal normal levels of B cells but a significantly reduced level of serum IgG, with markedly elevated IgM levels. Flow cytometry confirms the presence of CD40 on B cells. Based on these findings, which of the following processes is most likely defective in this patient?

A 39-year-old woman with a history of similar episodes since childhood and a family history of comparable symptoms presents with acute severe dyspnea, laryngeal stridor, and airway obstruction but no fever, urticaria, or recurrent infections. Normal lab values for WBC, hematocrit, and platelets are noted. Which deficiency is likely responsible for her condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) C1 inhibitor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The deficiency in C1 inhibitor leads to hereditary angioedema, which presents with recurrent, non-urticarial edema and is not associated with an allergic reaction or anaphylaxis.

questions.text: Which of the following is the diagnosis for a condition having mutation in COL4A5 chain?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Alport’s syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The mutation in the COL4A5 gene is associated with Alport's syndrome, which affects the basement membranes of the kidneys, cochlea, and eyes.

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman has been experiencing unilateral headaches on the right side for the past five months. Physical examination does not reveal any significant abnormalities. A lesion is visible on the CT scan of her head, as shown in the accompanying brain image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Meningioma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the context of neuroimaging, a well-circumscribed, extra-axial lesion, especially one that causes unilateral symptoms such as headaches without significant neurological deficits, is most suggestive of a meningioma. Meningiomas are commonly benign and can be surgically resected depending on their size and location.

questions.text: Which one of the following inflammatory markers of muscle biopsy is diagnostic of polymyositis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) CD8/MHC-I complex

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the diagnosis of polymyositis, a muscle biopsy showing CD8+ T cells in association with MHC-I on muscle fibers is a critical finding, differentiating it from other inflammatory myopathies.

questions.text: A cell lineage obtained from a 45-year-old Caucasian male demonstrates unusually high replicative potential. An activating mutation of which of the following genes is most likely present in this cell lineage?
Which mediators involved in the early phase of type 1 hypersensitivity ? Mast cell Histamine Neutrophils Prostaglandins Leukotrienes
What is the content of given vacutainer?
What is the correct sequence of cellular events of inflammation? Rolling Cytokine mediated integrin activation Adhesion Migration
Which of the following feature is correct on the basis of given karyotype?

All of the following statements about proto-oncogenes are true except? BRCA1 is an oncogene. HER2neu is amplified only in a fraction of breast cancer. EGFR (+) is seen in non-small cell lung cancer. N-MYC is a tumour suppressor gene.

An unfortunate incident occurred during a football match, where a young 20-year-old athlete tragically collapsed and was subsequently rushed to the hospital. Despite all efforts, the medical team could not save him, and he was pronounced deceased. The autopsy image provided gives us important information to investigate the cause of his untimely passing. What can be the most likely cause of death?

options.label: A
options.text: Valvular heart disease due to Rheumatic Heart Disease

options.label: B
options.text: Sudden cardiac death due to arrhythmia

options.label: C
options.text: Sudden cardiac death due to Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

options.label: D
options.text: Sudden cardiac death due to atherosclerosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Sudden cardiac death due to arrhythmia

questions.text: A patient presents with an acute episode of hemolyis after drug ingestion. His peripheral smear is given along sides. Which of the following statements accurately describe the effects of Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency? Decrease in reduced glutathione Decreased NADPH Decreased lipid peroxidation Decreased RBC membrane damage
Which of the following symptoms is least likely to be observed in a patient diagnosed with Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria (PNH)?

Which of the following statements is true regarding clear cell carcinoma of the kidney? It is the most common sporadic renal tumor Associated with loss of long arm of chromosome 3 Arises from distal convoluted tubule Cells show intracellular accumulation of glycogen and fat
Which of the following is the phenomenon of a differential effect of the same gene from different parents?
Donor blood should be screened for the following infections except:
All of the following conditions are caused by high-risk strains of Human Papilloma virus except:
In which of the following phenomenon, “cell in cell” appearance is seen associated with degradation of the engulfed cell ?
What can be the mechanism by which phagolysosome cause cell death in autophagy?

options.label: A
options.text: Is both intra and extra cellular

options.label: B
options.text: Can fuse with other organelles directly

options.label: C
options.text: Fuses with lysosome to form autophagolysosome

options.label: D
options.text: It is a single membrane structure

questions.correct_answer: C. Fuses with lysosome to form autophagolysosome
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Fuses with lysosome to form autophagolysosome

questions.text: Which of the following tumors shows the following finding?
Which of the following statements are true about hereditary spherocytosis?

options.label: A
options.text: It takes 1-2 years for gall stones to develop

options.label: B
options.text: Splenectomy is not protective against developing gall stones

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in MCH is pathognomonic of HS

options.label: D
options.text: It shows spheroctyosis with a positive family history

questions.correct_answer: D. It shows spheroctyosis with a positive family history
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It shows spheroctyosis with a positive family history.

questions.text: A 14-year-old patient presents with bilateral sensorineural hearing loss. On MRI, a mass is noted at the bilateral CP angles. Biopsy was done which revealed the finding shown in the image below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In patients of breast Cancer, which of the following results of IHC staining for Her-2/neu will further require FISH for gene amplification?

options.label: D
options.text: Gene Amplification is done irrespective of Her 2 Neu status

questions.text: A 28-year-old male patient is brought to the OPD with severe breathlessness. On echocardiography, Mitral stenosis with left atrial hypertrophy is seen. Vegetations present on the mitral valve were excised. What could be the most likely diagnosis based on the given histopathological examination finding?
Which of the following is true about gamma delta T cell receptors?

options.label: A
options.text: Antigens recognized are lipid antigens without MHC proteins

options.label: B
options.text: Antigens recognized are protein antigens without MHC proteins

options.label: D
options.text: CD3 is required for antigen recognition

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigens recognized are lipid antigens without MHC proteins
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Antigens recognized are lipid antigens without MHC proteins

questions.text: Amongst different types of cancer, which one exhibits the least frequent spread through the lymphatic route?
What important considerations should be known regarding the transfusion of blood received from a blood bank?

options.label: A
options.text: It should be started within 4 hours of receiving it from the blood bank.

options.label: B
options.text: It should be completed within 4 hours of receiving from the blood bank.

options.label: C
options.text: No such time restraint and can be done anytime.

options.label: D
options.text: It should be completed within 6 hours of receiving from the blood bank.

questions.correct_answer: B. It should be completed within 4 hours of receiving from the blood bank.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It should be completed within 4 hours of receiving from the blood bank.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man, known to be HIV-positive, visited the hospital due to a persistent fever and difficulty in breathing lasting for a period of two weeks. Imaging studies revealed a dense infiltration in the lower lobe of the lung. Subsequent lung biopsy findings were as follows. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following markers is typically not a good prognostic factor in a patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL)?
Among the provided options, which statement accurately describes Turner's syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Webbing of hands and toes are associated with risk of visceral anomalies

options.label: B
options.text: Noonan syndrome is more associated with cardiac defects

options.label: C
options.text: Absence of neck webbing is associated with higher risk of coarctation of aorta

options.label: D
options.text: Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac anomalies

questions.correct_answer: D. Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac anomalies
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac anomalies

questions.text: In the emergency room, a patient with severe bleeding and an unknown blood group requires fresh frozen plasma. Which of the following blood groups can be used for transfusion in this situation?
Based on the provided serum electrophoresis image, what is the most probable diagnosis?

The first bag was infused successfully in 2 hours, but during the administration of the second bag, the patient experienced shortness of breath and hypertension. Vitals showed a blood pressure of 180/120 mmHg and a pulse rate of 110 bpm. What is the likely cause of these symptoms?
